p: The results exhibited that the effects of the habitat of the plant is clear in the differences in quantity and quantity of phenolic compounds. It was reported that the total phenolic content of Thymus vulgaris and Thymus daenensis was induced by 20% after the application of 60 mM NaCl and in consequence improved the antioxidant capacity [ 40]. It was reported that salinity induces the production of phenolic compounds as a mechanism of acclimatization to stressful conditions [ 41].
